AD_GondianLeaderEncouragement.synopsis: Toobin shouts encouragements to the other Gondians on his turn during combat
AD_GondianLeaderEncouragement.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen Reconuse "oe low_foundry_fundangofollower"go to -1966; -9; 444get into a fight. Toobin will speak one line at the start of his turn every turn

WulbrenThanks.synopsis: Followup dialog with Wulbren after siding with him in the Foundry Outcome. He promises the player to back them up in the END fight.
WulbrenThanks.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -1935; -7; 206Use Debug Book to get runepowder bomb(Set quest flags and options > Act 3 Low > 10. Steel Watch Foundry > 5. Get Runepowder BombClick Neural Switchboard > 3. Carefully place the Rune Bomb Powder) wait for the explosion cinematic to finishobserve the cutscene.Choose to side with Wulbren against the Gondians, and kill them.Click on Wulbren to trigger this dialog

AD_Combat_Cultists_001.how_to_trigger: Fight Bane Cultist Guard - generic. AD triggered when taking a turn

ToobinThanks.synopsis: Toobin thanks the player for his help. If the the player has earned gondian support, Toobin also swears to back them up in the END fight.
ToobinThanks.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ause the debugbook to set up that the gondians are saved, and to teleport to the control centre of the foundry use "oe LOW_GiveBomb"go to the boss room on the floor and kill the bossesgo to the switchboard and use the bomb in the dialog to blow up the foundrygo through the outcome dialog, and side with the gondiansonce the dust settles, talk to Toobin

Outcome.synopsis: Outcome dialog between all important characters in the Steel Watch Foundry.Barchus may be dead so his participation is optionalToobin may also be dead, so his participation is also optional. If he is dead, he is replaced by a backup character representing the Gondians.
Outcome.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -1935; -7; 206Use Debug Book to get runepowder bomb(Set quest flags and options > Act 3 Low > 10. Steel Watch Foundry > 5. Get Runepowder BombClick Neural Switchboard > 3. Carefully place the Rune Bomb Powder) wait for the explosion cinematic to finishobserve the cutscene.

AD_Combat_Cultists_003.how_to_trigger: Fight Bane Cultist Guard - generic. AD triggered when taking a turn

FundangoLosesHope.synopsis: This dialog covers an edge case: the player has freed Iron throne prisoners, returned to the foundry and recruited Toobin as a follower. On the way to the control centre a kill switch accidentally goes off, killing all the gondians.Because of this Toobin is ready to give up. The player may attempt to persuade him to keep going.
FundangoLosesHope.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen the debug book and set the prisoners to savedOpen ReCon and use "oe low_foundry_fundangofollower"also set up "Roll horrible"teleport to -1982; -1; 420 and pick a fight with nearby enemies. Start killing them until a killswitch drops.Attempt to disarm one - because of roll horrilbe it will failobserve the consequencesFinish the fightthe dialog should auto-start

AD_Combat_Cultists_000.how_to_trigger: Fight Bane Cultist Guard - generic. AD triggered when taking a turn

AD_DeadMansSwitchWarnings.synopsis: The Dead Man's Swith ADs that indicate That it was activated and is counting down to the explosion.
AD_DeadMansSwitchWarnings.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_ATeleport to -1968; -6; 417Kill S_LOW_BaneiteOfficer09_0c5259f6-3c86-4e84-b61e-42e9f31691ceObserve the item being dropped and it hovers near the killed Baneite. The first node is spoken immediately, the second is spoken on the Switch's first turn.

IronThroneExplosionRumble.synopsis: The player has fail to disarm a KillSwitch, which has detonated the Iron Throne. The player feels the distant explosion as a rumble in the ground.
IronThroneExplosionRumble.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen ReConuse Roll HorribleGo to -1955; -4; 388kill S_LOW_BaneiteOfficer06_0ce716ac-f6fa-4b7d-8fda-456b0e74f90finteract with the dropped kill switchobserve cutscene play

Barcus_AfterOutcome.synopsis: A completely optional dialog with Barcus after the outcome of the Steel Watch Foundry has concluded. After the other gnomes leave Barcus sticks around until the next long rest. He looks at the burning Foundry and will react to what decisions you have made.
Barcus_AfterOutcome.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ause the debug book to set the IRN prisoners to your desired state (Use Prisoners saved if you want to save the Gondians) Go to -1933; -7; 205Use killcombat to defeat the mindflayer and other enemies nearbyUse any means to destroy the big neural machine.Watch escape cinematic, and have your outcome dialog. Based on your decisions Barcus should usually survive the outcome.Talk to Barcus after every other gnomes has left.

PAD_DeadMansSwitchDisarmed.synopsis: The player has successfully deactivated the 'Motivator' a device that, when triggered, will kill every single Gondian in the foundry (via shock collar) and blow up their families in a far off prison.These can trigger the first time you deactivate it (high tension), second time (there's no skill check, but you HAVE to get to it in time), and the third time.
PAD_DeadMansSwitchDisarmed.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen Recon and set up Roll amazingGo to -1968; -6; 417Kill S_LOW_BaneiteOfficer09_0c5259f6-3c86-4e84-b61e-42e9f31691ceClick on the Kill Switch that falls on the ground.

AD_Combat_Cultists_002.how_to_trigger: Fight Bane Cultist Guard - generic. AD triggered when taking a turn

AD_GondianLeaderEncouragement_1.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
AD_GondianLeaderEncouragement_1.text: Do not give up. Push them back!

AD_GondianLeaderEncouragement_2.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
AD_GondianLeaderEncouragement_2.text: Fight, my fellow Gondians! Take back your freedom!

WulbrenThanks_1.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
WulbrenThanks_1.text: The Gondian menace is finally over - now is the time for the Ironhand Gnomes.

WulbrenThanks_0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
WulbrenThanks_0.text: A true leader never forgets those who lifted him up.

WulbrenThanks_2.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
WulbrenThanks_2.text: When the time comes, you may call on the Ironhand Gnomes. We will fight with you to defend this city - it is ours, after all.

AD_Combat_Cultists_001_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BaneCultists_Combat
AD_Combat_Cultists_001_0.text: I have broken far stronger than you - you cannot win.

ToobinThanks_0.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_0.text: We need time to recuperate and rebuild, but the Gondians will survive - thanks to you.
ToobinThanks_0.context: NodeContext: determined, proud to call the player friend

ToobinThanks_1.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_1.text: While I cannot see it, I can feel the sun's embrace - and it is nothing short of divine. Thank you for doing the impossible, my friend. Simply call, and the Gondians will come - I swear it.

ToobinThanks_2.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_2.text: I think it is past time Obelia and I left this city - there is nothing for us here now.

ToobinThanks_3.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_3.text: I think it is past time I left this city - there is nothing for me here now.

ToobinThanks_4.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_4.text: I pity Wulbren - his brilliance was dazzling, but his mind was ruined by hatred. Thank you - for standing with us. Simply call, and the Gondians will come - I swear it.

ToobinThanks_5.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_5.text: I stand when so many have died. I thank you for what you have done for us, but I fear the Gondians are no more. At least no one else will suffer under the Steel Watch.

ToobinThanks_6.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
ToobinThanks_6.text: An alliance with the Ironhands? I didn't think it possible. The Gondians are in your debt, my friend. Simply call, and we will be by your side - I swear it.
ToobinThanks_6.context: NodeContext: admiring, proud to call player friend

Outcome_82.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_82.context: NodeContext: relieved, can't believe they made it out

Outcome_140.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_140.text: And the Foundry crumbles behind us - the sound is as sweet as a well-oiled cog.

Outcome_68.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_68.text: Today you did the impossible - and for that, the Gondians thank you. Whenever you need us, call out - and we shall be there.
Outcome_68.context: NodeContext: sincere, genuinely eternally grateful to the player

Outcome_27.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_27.text: Yet we paid the price in blood. So few of us remain - Gond's name will soon fade into the annals of history.
Outcome_27.context: NodeContext: Sad but also regined - he didn't think there was any other way

Outcome_133.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_133.text: I must leave now, and gather those of us still standing. Look after this city, my friend - I pray it treats you better than it did us.
Outcome_133.context: NodeContext: sad smile, trying to be grateful but can't help thinking of everyone who died

Outcome_78.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_78.text: Yet we paid the price in blood. The name Gondian means little when you are the only left.
Outcome_78.context: NodeContext: sad, dejected, knows everyone he loves is dead

Outcome_91.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_91.text: Look after this city, my friend - my place here is no more. But I know it is in good hands.

Outcome_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: shot of player and whatever remaining gnomes are alive panting, catching their breath. Wulbren appears and claps slowly

Outcome_36.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_36.text: It's been a while, my friend. I saw the explosion from across the pond - should've known you'd be right in the thick of it.
Outcome_36.context: NodeContext: like a cat with cream, he's got what he wanted

Outcome_49.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_49.text: Watchers collapse in the street as we speak. The city thanks you - I thank you.

Outcome_42.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_42.text: The Gondian menace is finally over - now is the time for the Ironhand Gnomes.

Outcome_117.speaker: Player
Outcome_117.text: Well done, Wulbren - you got what you wanted.

Outcome_39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_39.text: What we wanted, my friend - the dead Gondians who litter the streets are as much your kills as they are mine.

Outcome_24.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_24.text: When the time comes, you may call on the Ironhand Gnomes. We will fight with you to defend this city - it is ours, after all.

Outcome_108.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_108.text: A true leader never forgets those who lifted him up.

Outcome_121.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_121.text: Oh, it's just beginning - Baldur's Gate, beneath my hand, shall become a beacon of invention and ingenuity, you shall see.

Outcome_61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_61.text: And Toobin, my old friend. Terribly sorry, but I spotted your daughter floating in the harbour. By the looks of it, she wasn't bobbing for apples.
Outcome_61.context: NodeContext: cruel, a jab at toobin, anything to hurt him

Outcome_38.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_38.text: And Toobin, my old friend. Terribly sorry, but I spotted a bunch of Gondians floating in the harbour. By the looks of it, they weren't bobbing for apples.
Outcome_38.context: NodeContext: cruel, a jab at toobin, anything to hurt him

Outcome_132.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_132.text: What? But you said you saved them! That you'd help us!
Outcome_132.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player - horrified. Upset.

Outcome_92.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_92.text: But it's not over - so long as a single parasitic Gondian remains, Baldur's Gate is under threat.
Outcome_92.context: NodeContext: turns vicious - he won't rest until every single gondian is dead

Outcome_139.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_139.text: Wulbren, enough. The Gondians are no more - I am all that is left. You've won.

Outcome_129.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_129.text: Enough, Wulbren! Gortash enslaved us, forced us to build his Steel Watchers - but no more.

Outcome_23.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_23.text: Take the city - let the Ironhands reign supreme. I just wish to go home, and to hold my daughter.

Outcome_130.speaker: Player
Outcome_130.text: What about Gortash? What if he forces you to build up his Steel Watch once more?

Outcome_40.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_40.text: I will be long gone from this wretched city before that happens. I am no threat - I am... nothing.
Outcome_40.context: NodeContext: dejected, alone, all hope lost

Outcome_18.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_18.text: He'll never find us - we have safe-houses all over the city. We are no threat - I swear it.
Outcome_18.context:
NodeContext: determined, he will never let the gondians get hurt again
("safe houses" as in "safehouses" for shelter)

Outcome_44.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_44.text: Please - if a Gondian told me the sky was blue, I'd look outside and check.

Outcome_22.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_22.text: Toobin will lie, torment, and scheme until his dying breath. Kill him - or the Ironhands will.
Outcome_22.context: NodeContext: the mask has truly gone, we see wulbren for what he is - cruel, spiteful and viscious

Outcome_56.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_56.text: You Gondians will lie, scheme, and torment this city until your dying breaths. Let's end this.
Outcome_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands on weaponNodeContext: the mask has truly gone, we see wulbren for what he is - cruel, spiteful and viscious

Outcome_137.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_137.text: Wulbren - enough! I won't watch as you poison your soul - and the brilliant future that remains to the Ironhand Gnomes.

Outcome_28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_28.text: I thought the Ironhand Gnomes had corrupted you, Wulbren. Now I wonder if it wasn't the other way around.

Outcome_12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_12.text: Kill Toobin, and you kill all we love: Collaboration. Challenge. Solving problems with the power of reason, creativity, and invention.

Outcome_110.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_110.text: I still want to believe you're better than that, Wulbren. But even I am having my doubts.
Outcome_110.context: NodeContext: With pain in his voice. He's finally realizing his friend sucks ass, and it hurts.

Outcome_53.speaker: Player
Outcome_53.text: You carry the light and love of all that is good, Barcus. I think you would make an excellent leader of the Ironhands, don't you?

Outcome_51.speaker: Player
Outcome_51.text: By all that glitters, perhaps the Ironhand Gnomes need a new leader. What say you, Barcus?

Outcome_134.speaker: Player
Outcome_134.text: There's no honour among thieves, Barcus - and same goes for the Ironhands. Take Wulbren's place, lead them yourself!

Outcome_85.speaker: Player
Outcome_85.text: If this was an epic of old, Barcus here would summon his courage - and lead the Ironhand Gnomes.

Outcome_33.speaker: Player
Outcome_33.text: Perhaps the Ironhand Gnomes need a new leader. What say you, Barcus?

Outcome_66.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_66.text: I say... I say you're right. They deserve a leader who'll encourage them to create, not destroy. They deserve someone like me.
Outcome_66.context: NodeContext: Barcus character growth moment! Realizing he SHOULD be a leader. Eee!

Outcome_120.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_120.text: I can't save you from yourself, Wulbren. It hurts terribly, but I can't. Toss your values in the bin, if you want. But don't throw out the Ironhands' with them.
Outcome_120.context: NodeContext: Pain but resolve in his voice.

Outcome_75.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_75.text: This is ridiculous - Ironhands, kill this man!
Outcome_75.context: NodeContext: gesturing an order to the iron hands on either side of him -

Outcome_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: two ironhands on either side of Wulbren in attack pose - look at each other. Then stand up, hands away from their weapons

Outcome_104.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_104.context: NodeContext: rmeoves his hand from his weapon, realises his own men won't help him. Shocked, outraged

Outcome_62.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_62.text: The Gondians recognise Barcus Wroot as leader of the Ironhand Gnomes - and look forward to ushering in a new peace between our factions.
Outcome_62.context: NodeContext: formal, but a slight smile - he hated wulbren too

Outcome_125.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_125.text: It is with a heavy heart that I remove Wulbren Bongle from our ranks. You have until first light to leave the city, Wulbren.

Outcome_65.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_65.text: I expect treachery from all sides, but you - little Barcus? The boy who followed me from the Underdark, who clung to me like moss to stone?

Outcome_80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_80.text: When next we meet, my hammer will cleave your skull in two - and that is a promise.

Outcome_96.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_96.text: Hah! You know why I let this turnip cling to me, after all these years?
Outcome_96.context: NodeContext: cruel, knowing smile - speaking about barcus. Being a sick.

Outcome_89.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_89.text: Because despite his endless drivel, he lacks the mettle to do anything other than whine. You, on the other hand, I had actual hopes for.
Outcome_89.context: NodeContext: cruel, knowing smile - speaking about barcus. Being a sick.

Outcome_52.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_52.text: I thought you a rebel in arms. I see now you were but a snake waiting for its moment to strike.
Outcome_52.context: NodeContext: disgusted, appalled by the player

Outcome_115.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_115.text: Keep your precious Gondians - but know that I will not rest until this city is rid of them and their bootlickers.
Outcome_115.context: NodeContext: a disparaging wave, like he's doing you a favour

Outcome_26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_26.text: Keep your blind Gondian - I have no use for broken things. But know that I will not rest until this city is rid of the Gondians and their bootlickers.
Outcome_26.context: NodeContext: a disparaging wave, like he's doing you a favour

Outcome_141.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_141.text: When the day comes, my hammer will find your skulls - and crack them wide open. Ironhands - move out.

Outcome_113.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_113.text: No! The bastards must pay for their arrogance, their greed.
Outcome_113.context: NodeContext: nearly mad with anger, furious, outraged

Outcome_25.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_25.text: And a true rebel dies for his cause.

Outcome_95.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_95.text: You would choose a blind, broken Gondian over me? Your brother in arms?
Outcome_95.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player, genuinely hurt

Outcome_3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_3.text: No - I won't allow that bastard to live. And a true rebel dies with his cause.

Outcome_90.speaker: Player
Outcome_90.text: I know a hundred ways to kill you, Wulbren. So I'm only going to say this once - walk away.

Outcome_71.speaker: Player
Outcome_71.text: You are outnumbered and outmatched, Wulbren. Retreat - now.

Outcome_93.speaker: Player
Outcome_93.text: Walk away, Wulbren - I won't ask twice.

Outcome_21.speaker: Player
Outcome_21.text: Wulbren, don't make me burn you to a crisp. Walk away.

Outcome_46.speaker: Player
Outcome_46.text: Leave now, little Wulbren, or I'll split you from head to navel - and that's a promise.

Outcome_17.speaker: Player
Outcome_17.text: I'll give you a choice, Wulbren. Leave - or I'll slit your throat and offer your death up to the divine.

Outcome_8.speaker: Player
Outcome_8.text: I won't let you hurt the Gondians.

Outcome_10.speaker: Player
Outcome_10.text: Wulbren makes a good point - you must die for the city, Gondians.

Outcome_58.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_58.text: You saved us, risked your life for us, our families, only to kill us?
Outcome_58.context: NodeContext: betrayed, upset, horrified by the player

Outcome_124.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_124.context: NodeContext: betrayed, upset, horrified by the player

Outcome_116.speaker: Player
Outcome_116.text: Toobin has suffered enough - I won't let you hurt him.

Outcome_54.speaker: Player
Outcome_54.text: Sorry, Toobin - I guess this is it for you.

Outcome_138.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_138.text: You'd kill me after all we've been through?
Outcome_138.context: NodeContext: betrayed, upset, horrified by the player

Outcome_112.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Outcome_112.text: Kill the Gondians, and you kill all we love: Collaboration. Challenge. Solving problems with the power of reason, creativity, and invention.

Outcome_63.speaker: Player
Outcome_63.text: These Gondians are under my protection, Wulbren. You will not harm them.

Outcome_31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_31.text: You think your chapbook proclamation will stop me?

Outcome_2.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_2.text: If I have to cut you down to get to them - so be it.

Outcome_9.speaker: Player
Outcome_9.text: From one deep gnome to another, I'm asking you to stop this violence.

Outcome_118.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_118.text: You think your words carry more weight just because we're deep gnomes? Please. You are weak - like all the others. I see that now.

Outcome_103.speaker: Player
Outcome_103.text: The Gondians are good and just, Wulbren - I've seen it. Don't do this.

Outcome_1.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_1.text: After all we have accomplished, you would choose them over me? Your brother in arms?
Outcome_1.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player, genuinely hurt

Outcome_83.speaker: Player
Outcome_83.text: You've won, Wulbren - let it go.

Outcome_30.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_30.text: I planned to make you my right hand in the new reign of Ironhands - I see now you lack the spine.
Outcome_30.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player, genuinely hurt

Outcome_107.speaker: Gondian Menalda
Outcome_107.text: We have safe-houses all over the city - he will never find us, I swear it on my life.
Outcome_107.context:
NodeContext: pleading
("safe houses" as in "safehouses" for shelter)

Outcome_77.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_77.text: I think that if a Gondian told me the sky was blue, I'd look outside and check.

Outcome_37.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
Outcome_37.text: Take the city - let the Ironhands reign supreme. I just wish to go home and mourn my daughter in peace.

Outcome_59.speaker: Gondian Menalda
Outcome_59.text: Wait - wait! The Banites forced us to make the Steel Watchers, but it's over now. We are his slaves no more.

Outcome_7.speaker: Gondian Menalda
Outcome_7.text: If you let us go, you will never hear from us again - I swear it.

Outcome_20.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_20.text: That was a hell of a show, my friend. Watchers collapse in the street as we speak, and the Foundry?

Outcome_111.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_111.text: The scent of runepowder drifts through the city like a warm embrace - I see my bomb did the trick.

Outcome_76.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Outcome_76.text: Well - it won't stain this beautiful city with its abominations - not anymore.

Outcome_135.speaker: Gondian Menalda
Outcome_135.text: You did it - you destroyed the Foundry! Watchers are collapsing in the street as we speak.

Outcome_15.speaker: Gondian Menalda
Outcome_15.text: I will gather the survivors - get them to the safe-houses. Thank you for saving us.
Outcome_15.context:
NodeContext: grateful, jubilant
("safe houses" as in "safehouses" for shelter)

AD_Combat_Cultists_003_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BaneCultists_Combat
AD_Combat_Cultists_003_0.text: Subjugation. Domination. These are the tools of my trade, fool.

FundangoLosesHope_1.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_1.text: NO! We were close, so close to being free!
FundangoLosesHope_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: falls to his kneesNodeContext: falls to his knees. He's just seen every one of the gondians, his friends, die after their collars triggered (their heads blew off)

FundangoLosesHope_26.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_26.text: But it was all for naught. My friends, my fellow Gondians, they're dead - burned alive from the inside out.

FundangoLosesHope_8.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_8.text: You must finish this. Destroy the Foundry, end the Steel Watch.
FundangoLosesHope_8.context: NodeContext: can't go on, lacks the strength. Player is his only hope.

FundangoLosesHope_12.speaker: Player
FundangoLosesHope_12.text: I'm not leaving you behind - come on.

FundangoLosesHope_11.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_11.text: My strength is gone - my will shattered. I cannot.

FundangoLosesHope_20.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_20.text: Now go - you are our last hope to bring this nightmare to an end.

FundangoLosesHope_9.speaker: Player
FundangoLosesHope_9.text: This is your fight too - pull yourself together.

FundangoLosesHope_18.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_18.text: Blast it all, can I have no peace?

FundangoLosesHope_22.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_22.text: Fine. Let us move swiftly - before I change my mind.

FundangoLosesHope_13.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_13.text: I can't. I have no fight left in me. Nor the strength to survive what's to come.

FundangoLosesHope_0.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_0.text: If you reach the Neurocitor, input code 'Nebelun', then increase its output to maximum.
FundangoLosesHope_0.context: NodeContext: trying to give instruction the player, shoving down how upset he is

FundangoLosesHope_27.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_27.text: It will bring the Foundry down, and the Steel Watch with it. You can do this - you must.

FundangoLosesHope_23.speaker: Player
FundangoLosesHope_23.text: Rest - I have the runepowder bomb. I'll take it from here.

FundangoLosesHope_24.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_24.text: Thank you. I pray it burns every Banite to ashes - and that they suffer as my friends did.

FundangoLosesHope_5.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_5.text: Input code 'Nebelun' and increase the Neurocitor's output to maximum. Then run like every fiend from the Nine Hells is snapping at your heels.
FundangoLosesHope_5.context: NodeContext: trying to give instruction the player, shoving down how upset he is

FundangoLosesHope_4.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoLosesHope_4.text: Thank you. When this place burns, I only pray it takes the Banites with it.

AD_Combat_Cultists_000_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BaneCultists_Combat
AD_Combat_Cultists_000_0.context: NodeContext: vicious threat - low voice, confident.

AD_DeadMansSwitchWarnings_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_KillSwitches
AD_DeadMansSwitchWarnings_0.context: NodeContext: louder - collars are about to be triggered, and the iron throne is about to be destroyed

IronThroneExplosionRumble_0.speaker: Narrator
IronThroneExplosionRumble_0.text: *You hear an explosion, the earth shuddering beneath your feet in response. It must have come from somewhere nearby, perhaps in Grey Harbour.*

Barcus_AfterOutcome_4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_4.text: Go on, now - I know the way home from here.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_8.text: So many dead. Gondians. Ironhands... Wulbren. This wasn't supposed to happen.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_12.text: No. No, I don't think you did.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_21.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_21.text: This was for the best - now nobody gets Baldur's Gate.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_13.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_13.text: Well. Here we are. A most unexpected outcome.
Barcus_AfterOutcome_13.context: NodeContext: barcus has become leader of the ironhand gnomes

Barcus_AfterOutcome_47.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_47.text: You stood up to Wulbren - I'm impressed.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_48.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_48.text: I take no pleasure in ousting Wulbren. But he's not the old friend I remember. When did he get so angry? So violent?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_16.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_16.text: Someone like that cannot lead the Ironhand Gnomes. We need peace.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_31.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_31.text: You'll make a great leader of the Ironhand Gnomes.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_52.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_52.text: I am many things - a leader is not one of them. But no time like the present to learn. And I can't do worse than Wulbren, sorry as I am to say it.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_45.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_45.text: I don't know when he became so angry - so violent. But I'm glad to say I see the truth of it now. At last.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_23.text: Wulbren might be a violent bastard, but I have the privilege of being better than him.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_5.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_5.text: And now I have a great responsibility to boot. I'm not sure I know how to lead the Ironhand Gnomes, but I won't do worse than Wulbren, that's for sure.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_42.text: Thank you for your encouragement. I needed it. And have done since the day we met.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_22.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_22.text: I may have lost Wulbren. But I found a far preferable ally. Friend, even.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_56.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_56.text: Now! Myself and the Ironhand Gnomes have much to disentangle. But when you're ready to face what's waiting for you, believe me: we will be at your side.
Barcus_AfterOutcome_56.context: NodeContext: Too much vulnerability! Back to brass tacks.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_30.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_30.text: Shoo, then. For now. My friend.
Barcus_AfterOutcome_30.context: NodeContext: Barcus' awkward goodbye. Pathos underneath it, his stiffness in the middle. Affectionate but awkward.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_19.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_19.text: You - this was not the deal! You were meant to stop this madness - not... not... enmadden it!
Barcus_AfterOutcome_19.context: NodeContext: furious with player who has caused a LOT of deaths

Barcus_AfterOutcome_38.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_38.text: The Steel Watch is gone - that's all that matters.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_36.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_36.text: Not the lives of the Gondians you left to die? The bodies that burn in the foundry as we speak?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_46.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_46.text: The Gondians were a threat - they had to be stopped.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_44.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_44.text: 'Stopped'? Such a toothless word for cold-blooded murder.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_57.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_57.text: You want to die too, Barcus?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_10.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_10.text: I just saw you murder innocent people - you think I don't know what you're capable of?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_9.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_9.text: Like the Gondians who burn in the foundry as we speak?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_27.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_27.text: I wish you had left me tied to that infernal windmill. At least I would have been spared witnessing this horror.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_15.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_15.text: We won't meet again. Good day.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_26.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_26.text: I'm sorry - there was no other way.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_43.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_43.text: Lies, lies, and more lies. You chose this horror show. You should have left me tied to that infernal windmill. At least then I would've died without these horrible images in my mind.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_25.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_25.text: Go on - you have a city to save or something, don't you?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_50.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_50.text: I followed him through the city, to the wilds, through the Underdark, and back home again. Braved goblins, shades, and evils I could hardly describe.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_53.text: Still, I couldn't save Wulbren from himself. I don't think anyone could.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_11.text: So it seems. I don't know when he became so... angry. Perhaps he always was, and I was too naive to see it.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_18.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_18.text: I'm sorry it ended like this.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_17.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_17.text: I must... inform his family. Arrange his affairs, as much as I'm able.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_2.text: I wish it hadn't ended like this, but I know you did all you could to help Wulbren - to help me.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_1.text: I may have lost Wulbren. But I don't leave this place friendless. That much I know for certain.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_32.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_32.text: I wish you the very best. And then a little on top.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_41.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_41.text: Perhaps. But while you saw a madman, I saw the boy he once was.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_54.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_54.text: I have nothing left to say to you.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_29.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_29.text: Still, I just can't save Wulbren. He won't rest until the Gondians are dead. And you in the bargain.
Barcus_AfterOutcome_29.context: NodeContext: sad - he knows his friend is gone

Barcus_AfterOutcome_14.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_14.text: Let him come - I'll be ready.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_34.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_34.text: I know. And one of you will die. Wulbren, I'd wager.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_24.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_24.text: Why can't he let the Gondians be?

Barcus_AfterOutcome_49.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_49.text: Because he has the same weakness as the Gondians - pride. He's simply more honest about it. And more brutal.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_3.speaker: Player
Barcus_AfterOutcome_3.text: What about you? I doubt he's happy with you either.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_60.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_60.text: Let's be honest. Wulbren hasn't been happy with me in... hm. Ever, upon reflection.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_28.text: I'm starting to see the truth of him, believe it or not. My expectations of that mugungus have changed significantly. But I still want the best for him.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_37.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_37.text: Which is why I'm going after him. Someone has to stop him from ending his life in a blaze of foolishness.

Barcus_AfterOutcome_35.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Barcus_AfterOutcome_35.text: I'd tell you to write, but I never check the post. Farewell, my friend. And good luck.

AD_Combat_Cultists_002_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BaneCultists_Combat
AD_Combat_Cultists_002_0.text: Kneel - beg for mercy. You know it is your nature.
